subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Death in the Family "Experiment"!
author: Wiliam Clarke
full_text:
--0-91422277-1208970450=:45654
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

I will be recording tonight.  Do you do alot of session without recording? I just wandering.

Marlboro63@... wrote:            Hi Rees,
   
  I have done this before in fact just recently.  I did it with my brother's fatherinlaw 2 days after he died.  My technician helped me out and went and got this guy for me and I just about flipped when his voice actually came over the radio.  Unfortunately it did not record.  It was only meant for my ears.
   
  Jeff
   
    In a message dated 4/23/2008 11:58:46 A.M. Central Daylight Time, reesclarke_69@... writes:
          thank you and it does make very good sense.

itcdeadpeople <ITCdeadpeople@...> wrote:       Hi Rees. When I record, I'll ask for them. I think your views on the subject are wonderful, 
and not in the slightest disrespectful. 

I know for me, when someone makes their transition after having lived a long, full life, it 
isn't as hard for me to deal with because it's just sad, not tragic (if that makes sense.) I 
hope your great aunt and uncle are enjoying a glorious reunion! :-) 

Margaret

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "reesclarke_69" <reesclarke_69@...> wrote:
>
> 
> Hello guys, & gals
> 
> I hope everybody is having a great day, its a beatiful day in the 
> Bluegrass State of Kentucky. I just had a death in my Family, and I 
> was wandering if anybody does a session today/or tonight if you could 
> try to get in contact with a Mr. Charlie Clarke,(my Great Uncle) or 
> Mrs. Joann Clarke(his wife has past a couple of months ago)to see if 
> you can contact them. If you do contact him can you tell him that 
> Rees will be asking to speak with them tonight around 7-8pm eastern 
> time. To see if they can contact me. They lived a long and 
> wonderful life together. So all my family is sad to see him go, but 
> we know it was his time to leave, and life goes on. He should be 
> happy to be back with his wife. (He was 83 years old) I know 
> probaly somebody here might think this is crazy, dumb or 
> disrespectful, but that is my business. I think it should be easy to 
> get in contact with him since he just crossed over. Please let me 
> know if you tried and any evidence you might get from him.
> 
> Thanks
> 
> William Rees
>
